desc: ERF, a transcriptional repressor, is altered by mutation at low frequencies in various cancers.

The ERF gene encodes a member of the ETS-family of transcription factors (PMID: 21548782). ERF acts as a repressor of ETS2, another member of the ETS family, and its repression leads to EGF-induced cell migration (PMID: 22198386). ERF is a target of the MAP-kinase pathway, and it negatively correlates with expression of oncogenic c-MYC (PMID: 17699159, 17525531). ERF is mutated at low frequencies in various cancers (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Nov 2016).
